content: 1 teapot turtleneck by loopysue cozy up your teapot can wear this stylish turtleneck with the collar turned in folded out or even twisted and then folded down you can open it up to add more water and then re-close it measurements flat unstretched 6 wide x 12 tall fits most 6 to 8 cup teapots materials 1 ball of patons classic wool worsted 100 grams 3 53 ounces 210 yards 192 meters 4 0mm & 5 0mm circular needles or double pointed needles or sizes as required for gauge/purpose 1 stitch marker optional yarn needle for weaving gauge 4 in 2x2 ribbing on 4 0mm = 26 sts x 28 row pattern notes knit bottom up starts in the round splits for 2 sides worked flat then rejoins in the round to finish the top tube abbreviations st s stitch es round round m1k make one st knitwise k knit pw wyif purlwise with yarn in front m1p make one st purlwise p purl k2tog knit 2 sts together here s a nice make one video sl slip p2tog purl 2 sts together https //youtu be/zhorcljtkt0 beg beginning co cast on © 2015 suzanne resaul 2 teapot turtleneck by loopysue directions with 4 0mm co 80 sts join in the round without twisting mark beg/end of round with st marker if you like multiple of 4 for 2x2 ribbing knit 2x2 ribbing for 1 from co edge every round = p1 k2 p1 repeated to end start with a p1 so that later on the handle/spout split happens in the middle of a purl rib now will split for 2 sides of pot 40 sts each side the smaller needle will hold the unused sts until needed working flat back and forth always slip the 1st st pw wyif and always k the last st of every row switch to 5 0mm needle * right side facing increase row sl 1 pw wyif k1 m1k k1 p1 m1p p1 repeat 9 more times to last 3 sts of this half k1 m1k k2 59sts 10 knit ribs will be facing out to the right side work 3x3 ribbing wrong side facing sl 1 pw wyif p3 k3 repeat to last 4 sts p3 k1 right side facing sl 1 pw wyif k3 p3 repeat to last 4 sts k4 repeat these 2 row for 3 or 4 from co edge ending after completing a right side row * break yarn leave live 3x3 rib sts on needle repeat from * to * on the other half of the held 2x2 rib sts do not break yarn this time rejoin in the round place marker at beg of round and continue in 3x3 rib knit the knits and purl the purls note when rejoining the 2 selvedge sts that had been slipped while working flat will come together to make a new purl rib in the next round increase 1 st pw m1p in each of these 2 joining purl
